content.question: Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>7</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B7E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> be the fifth-degree Taylor polynomial for the function f about x = 0. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>‴</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C81@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?
